Pasta //pasta bolonaise Pasta bolonaise 
 1 pound (450g) ground beef or a mix of beef and pork 
 1 tablespoon olive oil 
 1 onion, finely chopped 
2 cloves garlic, minced 
 1 carrot, finely chopped 
 1 celery stalk, finely chopped 
 1 can (14 ounces/400g) crushed tomatoes 
 1/2 cup (120ml) red wine (optional) 
 1 teaspoon dried oregano 
1 teaspoon dried basil 
 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme 
 Salt and pepper to taste 
 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional, for some heat) 
 1 cup (240ml) beef or vegetable broth 
 2 tablespoons tomato paste 
 1 bay leaf 
 1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk 
1 pound (450g) spaghetti 
 Grated Parmesan cheese for serving Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the ground meat and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon. 
 Add chopped onion, garlic, carrot, and celery. Cook for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are softened. 
 Pour in the red wine (if using) and let it simmer for a couple of minutes until it's reduced by half. 
 Add crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil, thyme, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Stir well. 
 Mix in the broth, tomato paste, and bay leaf. Bring the mixture to a simmer and then reduce the heat to low. Let it simmer for at least 1 hour, stirring occasionally. The longer it simmers, the richer the flavor will be. 
 About 10 minutes before serving, add the milk and stir. 
 Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and toss with a bit of olive oil. 
 Serve the bolognese sauce over the cooked spaghetti. Top with grated Parmesan cheese. 
 Enjoy your delicious spaghetti bolognese!
//pasta carbonara
Pasta Carbonara 
 400g (14 oz) spaghetti or any pasta of your choice 
 150g (5 oz) pancetta or guanciale, diced (you can also use bacon as a substitute) 
 3 large eggs 
 1 cup (about 100g) grated Pecorino Romano cheese (or Parmesan) 
 1 clove garlic, peeled (optional) 
 Salt and black pepper to taste 
 Fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish (optional)
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. 
 While the pasta is cooking, heat a bit of olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the diced pancetta or guanciale and cook until it becomes crispy. If using bacon, cook until it's just beginning to brown. 
 In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, a pinch of black pepper, and a small pinch of salt. Set aside. 
 If you like a hint of garlic flavor, you can add a peeled clove of garlic to the pancetta while it cooks. Remove the garlic before adding the pasta and eggs. 
 Once the pasta is cooked, drain it but reserve about 1 cup of pasta cooking water. 
 Immediately add the hot, drained pasta to the pan with the pancetta (remove the garlic if used). Toss everything together to coat the pasta with the rendered fat. 
 Remove the pan from heat, and quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta. Toss vigorously to combine. The heat from the pasta will help create a creamy sauce. 
 If the sauce seems too thick, gradually add some of the reserved pasta cooking water until you reach the desired consistency. 
 Season with additional black pepper and salt if needed. 
 Garnish with chopped fresh parsley if desired, and serve immediately. 
 Enjoy your delicious Pasta Carbonara!
//pasta dinde
Pasta Dinde 
 8 oz (about 225g) fettuccine pasta 
 1 lb (about 450g) ground turkey 
 2 tablespoons olive oil 
 3 cloves garlic, minced 
 1 cup (240ml) heavy cream 
 1 cup (about 100g) grated Parmesan cheese 
 Salt and black pepper to taste 
 Fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish (optional)
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the ground turkey and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon as it cooks. 
 Add minced garlic and sauté for another minute until fragrant. 
 Pour in the heavy cream and bring it to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low. 
 Gradually add the grated Parmesan cheese, stirring continuously until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. 
 Season with salt and black pepper to taste. 
 Add the cooked and drained fettuccine pasta to the skillet with the turkey and Alfredo sauce. 
 Toss everything together until the pasta is well coated in the creamy sauce 
 Garnish with chopped fresh parsley if desired. 
 Serve immediately. 
 This Turkey Pasta Alfredo is a delicious and comforting dish that combines the richness of Alfredo sauce with the lean protein of ground turkey. Enjoy your meal!
//pasta seafood
SeaFood Pasta 
 8 oz (about 225g) linguine or spaghetti 
 1 lb (about 450g) mixed seafood (shrimp, mussels, calamari, etc.), cleaned and deveined 
 3 tablespoons olive oil 
 4 cloves garlic, minced 
 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (adjust to your spice preference) 
 1 cup (240ml) cherry tomatoes, halved 
 1/2 cup (120ml) dry white wine (optional) 
 1/2 cup (120ml) seafood or vegetable broth 
 Salt and black pepper to taste 
 Fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish 
 Grated Parmesan cheese for serving
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes. Sauté for about a minute until fragrant. 
 Add the mixed seafood to the skillet and cook until the shrimp turns pink and the other seafood is cooked through. This usually takes 3-5 minutes. 
 Add the halved cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes. 
 If using, pour in the white wine and let it simmer for a couple of minutes to reduce. Then, add the seafood or vegetable broth. 
 Add the cooked and drained pasta to the skillet with the seafood mixture. 
 Toss everything together, ensuring the pasta is well coated with the flavorful sauce. 
 Season with salt and black pepper to taste. 
 Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve immediately. 
 Optionally, sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top before serving. 
 Enjoy your delicious Seafood Pasta! Feel free to customize the seafood selection based on your preferences.
//saumon pasta Salmon Pasta 
 8 oz (about 225g) fettuccine or your favorite pasta 
 1 lb (about 450g) salmon fillets, skinless and boneless 
 2 tablespoons olive oil 
 4 cloves garlic, minced 
 1/2 cup (120ml) dry white wine (optional) 
 1 cup (240ml) heavy cream 
 1 lemon, zest and juice 
 Salt and black pepper to taste 
 Fresh dill, chopped, for garnish 
 Grated Parmesan cheese for serving Cut the salmon into bite-sized pieces. 
 In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for about a minute until fragrant. 
 Add the salmon pieces to the skillet and cook until they are opaque and easily flake with a fork. This usually takes 4-6 minutes. 
 If using, pour in the dry white wine to deglaze the pan. Let it simmer for a couple of minutes to reduce. 
 Reduce the heat to low, and pour in the heavy cream. 
 Add lemon zest and juice to the skillet, stirring gently. 
 Season with salt and black pepper to taste. 
 Add the cooked and drained pasta to the skillet with the salmon and sauce. 
 Toss everything together until the pasta is well coated. 
 Garnish with chopped fresh dill. 
 Optionally, sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top before serving. 
 Enjoy your delicious Salmon Pasta! This dish combines the creaminess of the sauce with the flakiness of the salmon for a delightful meal.
//tuna Pasta
Tuna Pasta 
 8 oz (about 225g) penne or your favorite pasta 
 2 cans (about 10 oz each) tuna, drained 
 2 tablespoons olive oil 
 1 small onion, finely chopped 
 2 cloves garlic, minced 
 1 can (14 ounces/400g) crushed tomatoes 
 1 teaspoon dried oregano 
 1/2 teaspoon dried basil 
 Salt and black pepper to taste 
 Red pepper flakes (optional, for some heat) 
 1/4 cup (60ml) black olives, sliced (optional) 
 2 tablespoons capers, drained (optional) 
 Fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish 
 Grated Parmesan cheese for serving In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until it becomes translucent. 
 Add minced garlic and cook for an additional minute until fragrant. 
 Stir in the crushed tomatoes, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using). 
 Simmer the sauce for about 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld. 
 Add the drained tuna to the skillet and break it up with a spoon, incorporating it into the sauce. 
 If using, add sliced black olives and drained capers. Stir well and let it simmer for a few more minutes. 
 Add the cooked and drained pasta to the skillet with the tuna sauce. 
 Toss everything together until the pasta is well coated in the sauce. 
 Garnish with chopped fresh parsley. 
 Optionally, sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top before serving. 
 Enjoy your simple and delicious Tuna Pasta! This dish is versatile, and you can customize it by adding your favorite herbs or vegetables.
//tofu pasta
Tofu Pasta 
 8 oz (about 225g) pasta (e.g., spaghetti, fettuccine, or your choice) 
 1 block (about 14 oz/400g) extra-firm tofu, pressed and cubed 
 3 tablespoons soy sauce 
 2 tablespoons sesame oil 
 2 tablespoons olive oil 
 2 cloves garlic, minced 
 1 teaspoon ginger, grated 
 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced 
 1 carrot, julienned 
 2 green onions, sliced 
 1 tablespoon rice vinegar 
 1 tablespoon maple syrup or agave nectar 
 Sesame seeds for garnish 
 Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish (optional) Press the tofu to remove excess water, then cut it into small cubes. 
 In a bowl, toss the tofu cubes with soy sauce until well coated. 
 Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tofu cubes and cook until they are golden brown on all sides. Remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside. 
 In the same skillet, add sesame oil. Sauté minced garlic and grated ginger until fragrant. 
 Add sliced bell pepper, julienned carrot, and sliced green onions. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp. 
 Add the cooked and drained pasta to the skillet with the vegetables. 
 Return the cooked tofu to the skillet and toss everything together. 
 In a small bowl, mix rice vinegar and maple syrup. Pour this mixture over the pasta and tofu. Toss to coat everything evenly. 
 Garnish with sesame seeds and fresh cilantro or parsley if desired. 
 Serve immediately. 
 Enjoy your delicious and nutritious Tofu Pasta! Feel free to add more vegetables or adjust the seasoning according to your preferences. 1 2 4 3 7 5 6
